definition: The quality of being resonant or echoing.
example: The idea struck with deep resonance.

definition: To twist or interweave in such a manner as not to be easily separated.
example: Quantum particles can become entangled and act as one system.

definition: To fall together suddenly; to fold or cave in.
The combination of two or more physical states into one.
example: In quantum mechanics, particles can exist in superposition.

definition: A state in which two systems are connected such that the state of one affects the other.
example: Quantum entanglement links particles across vast distances.
